questions.question: What are the advantages and disadvantages of hosting different international sporting events in a country?
points: What are the advantages and disadvantages of hosting different international sporting events in a country?

essays.essay: The organization of sporting events, especially international events, is an issue that receives a lot of attention, because it brings many benefits but at the same time causes disadvantages for the hosting country. First, one of the benefits that must be mentioned is that international sporting events are an ideal opportunity for host countries to attract the attention of a global audience so they can promote culture and traditions. Furthermore, thanks to hosting, the host country can boost its economy in the service industry, strengthening relationships between countries. On the other hand, the presence of too many people from other countries can cause a significant increase in disorderly behavior and the host country may be susceptible to the spread of disease from other countries. In general, a country hosting a tournament brings many benefits, but we need to consider the appropriateness of our country's economic and cultural circumstances to best avoid risks.

context.sent: The organization of sporting events, especially international events, is an issue that receives a lot of attention, because it brings many benefits but at the same time causes disadvantages for the hosting country.

questions.question: Describe your favourite food.
points: Describe your favourite food.

essays.essay: I would like to talk about my favorite food banh mi. It is very popular in Vietnam. Almost people like it because it has a reasonable price and delicious taste. In addition, it is convenient that I can eat easily by hand without cutlery or crockery. I usually have banh mi for my breakfast or sometimes for my dinner. Another reasons why I love it because I can make it simply. Banh mi includes bread, eggs, meet like pork, vegetables like lettuce, carrot, tomato, sauces, and it also contains many other ingredients. To make banh mi, firstly, I prepare the filling of the bread, such as I wash and chop lectures, tomatoes, carrots, fry eggs, and grill meat. Secondly, I cut in the middle of the bread and put the filling of the bread that I prepared inside the bread. Finally, I pan-fry banh mi to make it hotter and crispier. The steps to make banh mi are simple, so I don't take many time to make it. Thus, with me, banh mi is a really nutritious and convenient food that suitable for everyone.

questions.question: Describe a school you went to in your childhood
points: Describe a school you went to in your childhood

essays.essay: I'm pretty sure that schools play an important part in everybody's growing up process. And for me, one of my special school ever is my primary school. It was one of the smallest school in my town. To the best of my recollection, my school was located in a small alley near a river, within a distance that my grandpa rode me on a bike to school throughout five years. Back in the days, I remember that I was so impressed by how cute it looked from the front. It had a yellow gate and when I walked inside, there were plenty of colorful walls surrounding three blocks of buildings, which only consisted of three floors. It was quite small, but what I love the most was the playground there. It was the place where I and my friend played games together during the breaks. We had so much fun, and we learn from each other a lot. The teachers were friendly, patient and kind, they taught us a lot about how to become a good person right now. The school was my first time for everything. It is more about the people than the actual place. We are so grateful for leaving footprints at every corner there. If I have a chance in the future, I will definitely pay a visit to my school again.

questions.question: Describe a perfect job you would like to have in the future
points: Describe a perfect job you would like to have in the future

essays.essay: Since my childhood, I was always wondering what I would like to be once I grew up. Over the years, I observed the functioning of different jobs and tried to find what interested me. Now, I might know the answer to this question is to become an interpreter. I derived inspiration for taking this role because of some movies I have seen on TV, at first I just thought on impulse since I was engrossed in the appearance and idiosyncrasy of the interpreters. However, as I grew up, I gradually found out I was attracted by how this job operates, but only about its outer. According to my search, interpreters interpret verbal communication from one language to another. Acting as mediums where language barriers exist, at times, interpreters translate written communication from one language to another. These people work in various fields such as education, healthcare, insurance, legal and other industries. As changeable a person as I am, I always find a job that can offer flexibility. It's not just sitting with an air conditioner turning on and being wrapped up in papers. Therefore, interpreter is a nice option. As I hold a belief it will allow me to discover this whole wide world. On the other hand, we are now living in a modern world, right? This means economic relations with foreign countries are increasing exponentially. That's why knowing some languages inside out, in some ways helps me to have a brighter future.

questions.question: Describe an important car journey that was delayed.
points: Describe an important car journey that was delayed.

essays.essay: believe that everyone should have spare time to explore different places. Even my family loves to do so. Last year, we planned to visit the stunning coastal city of Nha Trang in Vietnam and we decided to cover this quite long distance by car. This was in July, and we set off on our journey early in the morning, excited to explore the beauty of Nha Trang. It was an essential journey for us because all family members usually remain busy with our work most of the time. Only in July, everyone got some free time to enjoy themselves properly with family members, so we didn’t want to miss the opportunity to spend that precious time together. We expected to arrive at around 11 a.m, just at lunch time and enjoyed a meal at one of the well-known seafood restaurants nearby. Suddenly! Our car stopped working 30 km away from our destination. Even though my father had proper knowledge about how to handle a car breakdown, that day, it was really hard for him to find the problem. At last, he googled and luckily there was a repair shop nearby, so we decided to call their emergency number for help. As a result, after 2 hours to solve the issue, we finally reached our destination. Generally, with picturesque landscapes, lush greenery along the way, and specialties, we all were happy that day even after our journey was delayed.

essays.essay: So today, I would like to talk about Leopold Vincent, a French man who had moved to Vietnam for, like, thirty years, and he's also a rescuer, an animal rescuer who has saved, hundreds of animals live. When I was reading some newspapers online, I came across a title title talking about him and his house. At that time, it was just a small flat. And, from what I read, it just totally freeze me and amaze me a lot. I mean, I was totally captivated by his devotion to what he he did. He used to be a barista in France and moved to Vietnam with his Vietnamese wife. And he hated when he saw the way animals in Vietnam such as cats or dogs are treated unfairly. He's a generous person and an animal lover who has a deep compassion on them and has a strong belief on animal welfare. So he has rescued their life and treat them with great care. I really admire him because he has a great dedication to take care of all the sick animals and the animals that are abandoned and he has spent his whole life moving many places just to buy the best place for for his animals. Even though his neighbor didn't like him, but I think that he did a great job for the community and for Vietnam.

essays.essay: I would like to describe my teacher who taught me literature in high school. She left a profound impression on me, and she was the role model whom I always looked up to. Her name is Phuong. She was in her 40s, but she looked young enough to be my older sister. She cared about us as if we had been her sons and daughters. For example, if students were facing problems in studying or personal life, she would spend time on having private conversations with them, shared useful advice and gave physical or spiritual support. What struck me most is the way she taught us in class, the beauty and meaning of every literary works were explained and delivered by her clear and mellifluous voice. Besides, because of her love which was spread throughout her lessons, I realized the importance of this subject. Studying literature enables us to see the world through the eyes of others, to experience different kinds of emotions, help us perceive the truth and deal with the complexities of life in creative ways. Not only her excellence in profession but also her lifestyles inspired me a lot. My friend told me that she used to undergo many surgeries due to her illness. However, she did not even talk about it one time. She always express the most positive and optimistic attitude towards difficulties. Although it has been a long time since the day I graduated from high school, what she said and did for me still living in my heart.

questions.question: Describe the first day of your school
points: Describe the first day of your school

essays.essay: honestly, I start to study at school when I was 2 or 3 years old. However, I still recall vividly about the first day at primary school. I distinctly remember that on that day, the weather was actually bad, however, it totally did not impact negatively my mood. Although black clouds covered the whole sky outside, I still told mum to take me to school early because I didn't want to be late on the first day of school. On the road to school. I had butterflies in my stomach because I worried that I wouldn't be able to make friends with anyone and would have difficulties in adapting to a new class as well as teacher. Luckily, at the first step into the school gate, I met some old friends who studied with me at kindergarten. Honestly, they saved me from terrible anxiety. After that, I sat in the class to wait for teacher. Contrary to my fearfulness, my teacher and classmates were very kind and hilarious. Although it was rainning cats and dogs, being surrounded by may people who are adorable is literally a part I enjoy the most about the first day at school. In short, when I recall old memory, I still found the first at primary school was a memorable experience in my life.

questions.question: Describe a special toy you had in your childhood.
points: Describe a special toy you had in your childhood.

essays.essay: Now i'm going to tell you about a special toy I had when I was a child. That was To he, a traditional toy originated from Xuan La village, which was a traditional craft village located only around 40 km from Hanoi centre. As I can recall, my father gave it to me after his business trip to Hanoi. I can vividly remember that To he had the shape of an animal or a fruit. It was made from a special type of rice powder with some natural colors so it was edible. The skilled craftsmen need a mixture which was easily to knead into various eye-catching shapes and stick stuck on bamboo stick. The reason why I think that To he was a special toy is that I live in the central of Vietnam and that was the first time I had seen that kind of toy. It was only ubiquitous in the North and was sold only on two special occasions: Tet holiday and Mid-autumn festival. To he was really a cultural ambassador which let me know more the beauty of Vietnam culture.

questions.question: Describe a unique marketplace you want to visit.
points: Describe a unique marketplace you want to visit.

essays.essay: I always wanted to go to Dong Xuan market. It is one of the largest markets in Northern Vietnam, where customers can buy the goods they want at affordable prices. In this place, they sell all kinds of goods like clothes, jewelry, electronic devices, birds, and pets. Also, the indispensable important thing at the market is food and food stalls. This market existed for hundreds of years, and it is located in the Hanoi Old Quarter area. Besides, it is about 800 meters from Hoan Kiem Lake, quite close to Hang Ma Street and Long Bien station. All of those locations attract many tourists, so I think it is unique to this market. Dong Xuan market is also unique in the low price of goods but still good quality, so a lot of people go here every day. I think no one can leave this place in disappointment. In addition, it attracts part of young people to come here to buy clothing, and shoes, and see some fashion accessories stores. Because I am also a young person, I want to go to this market to buy some clothes at a much cheaper price than some shops and try some famous food here. My house is far from this market, so I haven't had a chance yet. I think maybe I can come with my friend in the future.
